evergreen endurance of a single garment for all seasons of motherhood.

Katherine Louise DeGroot <https://substack.com/@katherinelouisedegroot>
Sep 26
<https://substack.com/@katherinelouisedegroot>

<https://substack.com/app-link/post?publication_id=846138&post_id=149455732&utm_source=substack&isFreemail=true&submitLike=true&token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoyMjE1MDMwODEsInBvc3RfaWQiOjE0OTQ1NTczMiwicmVhY3Rpb24iOiLinaQiLCJpYXQiOjE3MjczNjg3MDAsImV4cCI6MTcyOTk2MDcwMCwiaXNzIjoicHViLTg0NjEzOCIsInN1YiI6InJlYWN0aW9uIn0.l65GBy2TEDRVI_vXp3fT4RuwNwpNp_Zfb8pAH3h4eIs&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=email-reaction&r=3nvkvd>
<https://substack.com/app-link/post?publication_id=846138&post_id=149455732&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&isFreemail=true&comments=true&token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoyMjE1MDMwODEsInBvc3RfaWQiOjE0OTQ1NTczMiwiaWF0IjoxNzI3MzY4NzAwLCJleHAiOjE3Mjk5NjA3MDAsImlzcyI6InB1Yi04NDYxMzgiLCJzdWIiOiJwb3N0LXJlYWN0aW9uIn0.RDscoAlSiPzvRS7KrYXgfocbt6drxvz6AkPu21qz7f8&r=3nvkvd&utm_campaign=email-half-magic-comments&action=post-comment&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email>
<https://substack.com/app-link/post?publication_id=846138&post_id=149455732&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&utm_campaign=email-share&action=share&triggerShare=true&isFreemail=true&r=3nvkvd&token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoyMjE1MDMwODEsInBvc3RfaWQiOjE0OTQ1NTczMiwiaWF0IjoxNzI3MzY4NzAwLCJleHAiOjE3Mjk5NjA3MDAsImlzcyI6InB1Yi04NDYxMzgiLCJzdWIiOiJwb3N0LXJlYWN0aW9uIn0.RDscoAlSiPzvRS7KrYXgfocbt6drxvz6AkPu21qz7f8>
<https://substack..nF1d4P5dB8Z5pQulSBJxk33mlkeP-xo9Nro8O92vaO0?&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email>

READ IN APP
<https://open.substack.com/pub/katherinelouisedegroot/p/in-praise-of-the-midi-dress-with?utm_source=email&redirect=app-store&utm_campaign=email-read-in-app>

<https://substack.com/redirect/185b1566-4a82-4b76-be0c-909af592e1ea?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>
Photo
by Maggie Witter Photography | Dress by Hill House

I’ve been reading a bit more fiction lately and discovered a funny tweet
from one of the new authors I’m enjoying. In a moment of frustration, she
lamented about the trend of midi dresses with sleeves. While I love me a
good dress, I do empathize with despising certain trends. It’s evident that
some silhouettes flatter some body types and not others.

Pretty much every day I wear a midi dress with puffed sleeves. I love them.

I have no conviction against jeans, I just haven’t found a pair that both
fits properly or are comfortable. So, around 2017 I stopped wearing then.
It was gradual. I donated my final pair of jeans after the pandemic. I’d
love to find some at some point, but I don’t really have the energy to go
try some on. I could be wrong but it doesn’t sound like a good time. I did
recently try to put on a pair of Seth’s jeans, thinking we could share, but
couldn’t get them over my very much childbearing hips.

My body has changed so much over the past six years and four babies. It is
rare that a garment will endure. I’ll stick to my midi dresses with
sleeves. It’s not a religious thing, it’s just what I feel cute in.

I love a good midi dress for several reasons:

They’re long enough where you can bend down without embarrassment. I can
get on the floor with the kids and play with them without worry.

Short sleeves mean I can layer on a knit if it’s chilly. These dresses go
from spring to summer to fall and perhaps winter, though usually in winter
I switch to shorter dresses that I pair with leggings.

Smocked tops make pregnancy and nursing a breeze. I have a theory that
you’re either a pull upper or pull downer with nursing, and as someone
whose first baby needed significant latch adjustments I had to be a pull
downer so I could see best. These dresses make nursing easy and expand or
shrink with adjusting bust measurements.

Few garments can take you from pregnancy, to postpartum, to evergreen like
a midi dress can. They accommodate a bump very well. They are flattering
and comfortable during postpartum. They’re cute and beautiful during
everyday motherhood. Cotton and linen washes well.

Dresses are, in sum, the most functional of garments.

I’m partial to the evocative *Christy Dawn
<https://substack.com/redirect/65212522-9c27-4dce-b4d1-cb55baa36e35?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*
and *Doen
<https://substack.com/redirect/f2ce943f-56cd-4680-800f-1c4cd21397a5?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*
(both easy to find on Poshmark) and love the *Neuflora
<https://substack.com/redirect/591735de-dd58-49be-a0b4-6e440b72e445?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*,
*Hill House
<https://substack.com/redirect/fba518c0-ba03-406f-97c5-168216692e58?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*,
and *Ivy City
<https://substack.com/redirect/fabc5c69-0c22-4d75-a70b-583c3f828b8d?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*
brands as well. My wintertime dresses are almost always *Pyne and Smith
<https://substack.com/redirect/3376925d-f75a-4829-9649-79fbdb03fb5c?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>*
.

To my fellow dress lovers, please share your favorites in the comments
below.

READ IN APP
<https://open.substack.com/pub/schoolforhousewives/p/motherly-love-makes-the-home?utm_source=email&redirect=app-store&utm_campaign=email-read-in-app>

<https://substack.com/redirect/d3847a18-f877-4252-8151-e5fdee8d18a9?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>

It was raining so hard the other night when we had friends over for dinner
that I ended up making a small arrangement with flowers I had dried on a
rack the week before! I just couldn’t go outside to pick anything!

I encourage you to make the extra effort to do things a little more nicely
every day, even when things in general seem like a bit of a disaster!

For instance, setting the family table with care helps the children to
learn the importance of order and everyday beauty.

Subscribe to get little messages of practical encouragement in your inbox!
Your support is greatly appreciated!

Upgrade to paid
<https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9zY2hvb2xmb3Job3VzZXdpdmVzLnN1YnN0YWNrLmNvbS9zdWJzY3JpYmU_.3bhBI5Dv2WOlx5ZrFlLyXG_HAv0cow12ryiKuwIQXtE?&utm_medium=email&utm_source=subscribe-widget-preamble&utm_content=149453219>

Later in life, their memories of these humble family times will protect
them from temptation to disorder or help them recover from confusion.

The housewife has this crucial role in these small matters that turn out to
be instruments of peace. I wrote more about it here
<https://substack.com/redirect/de3394c1-aa94-4e59-88c2-548e69280bae?j=eyJ1IjoiM252a3ZkIn0.hptu0O-MT2DS7SDOV_jCimRDM3mirJMsf_rwD4AuzuY>
.

*I hope you are making sandwich bread for your family this week and your
starter is doing well for you! Practicing this skill will build up your
bread-making muscles for the next step, which we will get to next week,
probably.*

Thanks for reading The School for Housewives! This post is public so feel
free to share it.
